- Game Step: SHOP

  2. Ancient Joker: X1.5 Mult per Spade card scored

  2. Venus - $3 (Level up Three of a Kind)
- Boosters:

- Vouchers:
  1. Overstock - $10 (I only have $3)
- Reroll cost: $5 (I only have $3)

**Analysis:**

With only $3, my options are very limited:
1. Buy Venus for $3 - This would level up Three of a Kind
2. Move on to Round Select

Looking at my play history:
- Straight - 2,403 chips
- Two Pair - 360 chips (played twice in Boss round, once in Big Blind)
- Pair - 232 chips
- Full House - 224 chips

I've been playing mostly Two Pairs (3 times), with one Straight, one Pair, and one Full House. I haven't played Three of a Kind yet, so Venus wouldn't immediately benefit my current strategy.

However, I'm entering Ante 2 which will have much higher chip requirements. The Small Blind in Ante 1 was around 300 chips, Big Blind around 450, and Boss around 600. In Ante 2, these will scale significantly - typically something like:


- Small Blind: ~900 chips
- Big Blind: ~1,400 chips  
- Boss: ~2,000+ chips

Venus would upgrade Three of a Kind to Level 2 with 50 chips and 5 mult, which could be valuable as difficulty increases. But since I haven't relied on that hand type yet, it's unclear if this investment makes sense compared to saving for better shop options in future rounds.

With only $3 remaining and no ability to reroll or purchase anything else, I'm weighing whether to spend it now or preserve resources. The real question is whether Three of a Kind becomes relevant enough to justify the expense, or if I'm better off banking the money to accumulate for more impactful upgrades later when I have more chips and better purchasing power.

### Should I skip the Small Blind?

The Top-up Tag would give me up to 2 Common Jokers. I have room for 2 more jokers (3/5 currently).

Pros of skipping:
- Get 2 Common Jokers for free (could be worth $6-10 in the shop)
- Common jokers could provide useful synergies

Cons of skipping:
- Lose $3 reward for beating the blind
- Don't get to accumulate money before harder blinds

The Top-up Tag offering 2 Common Jokers is tempting, but I need to prioritize cash flow to shop effectively and survive the round. Since I can beat the Small Blind without difficulty, I should focus on maintaining resources.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
